title: Getting browser out of date message from bank site
content:
I get this message " Please update your browser. You are unable to access this site because the browser you are using is not supported for this site. For the site you are accessing, the supported versions are: 

   Microsoft Edge Chromium = Most current and prior 2 versions    Mozilla Firefox = Most current and prior 2 versions*    Google Chrome = Most current and prior 2 versions*    Apple Safari = Most current and prior 2 versions*

It is important to keep your browser updated for many reasons. Browser vendors are constantly adding new features and functionality. Websites often update pages that require newer browsers to function correctly. But most importantly, staying current is required to combat the constant threat of security vulnerabilities. To maintain the safety and integrity of your data, a strict adherence to updated browser versions is required.

  • This browser requirement does not apply to users of the Administrator Portal"

My browser updates automatically.
creator: Deusvolt

title: "Finish installing Firefox?" when installed in user applications folder on Mac
content:
Hi, every time I open Firefox on a Mac I get a dialog asking me to "Finish installing Firefox", which will apparently add Firefox to /Applications and Dock.

The sysadmin who manages my Mac asked me to install Firefox into /Users/<user>/Applications instead of /Applications, and I do not have permission to install anything into /Applications anyway, so I cannot finish the installation. I already put Firefox into my Dock manually, so I don't need this dialog to do it for me.

The update window also says "This update requires administrator privileges", which should not be needed to update an app in /Users/<users>/Applications, but it looks like Firefox is trying to install updates into /Applications and failing because it does not have permission.

Is there any way to get rid of this dialog, and have Firefox work from /Users/<user>/Applications? Thanks.

title: Firefox using too much RAM
content:
Hello,

I've just downloaded firefox, making the switch from chrome. Doing so I've migrated a couple of tabs and extensions I had. Totally it was 50 tabs, with 6 extensions, I've downgraded now with the switch and it's only 37 tabs and 2 extensions, even so firefox is using more ram than google by a large amount. With 50 tabs open, chrome was using 1.5gigabytes of memory. With the same 37 tabs and extensions, firefox is currently using 6 gigabytes of memory.

The tabs used are from reputable sources, so firefox shouldn't be breaking on these websites. The extensions I am using at the moment on firefox is, Ublock origin, Dark Reader.

As far as reputation goes, firefox should be using less Ram than chrome. Is there a setting I should know about to lower such performance issues? Firefox acceleration is ON.

Thank you for any answers.

title: Scrolling when zoomed is not adjusted to the amount zoomed.
content:
I just downloaded firefox, I switched from chrome now that the new anti-adblock update is coming out. As such I'm trying to used to the new browser and set it up to my preferences.

So far I've had some problems, and I'd be thankful for any help I could get.

Firstly, when zoomed in using application menu, the scroll does not adjust the amount scrolled. For example, let's say the standard lines scrolled when i scroll with my mouse is 4. It's still 4 when zoomed in, as if I was still at 100%. This makes it scroll further down than needed, and to a person who likes to read, bothering. I presume there is an solution to this, as this doesn't happen on chrome for me. I tried checking out about:config and change mousewheel.default.delta_multiplier_y from 100 to somewhat lower.

This made all scrolling way too slow, even if only slightly lowered. And the amount scrolled normally isn't the problem, the problem is the amount scrolled does not adjust when zoomed in, still scrolling as if I was on 100% zoom instead of 250% zoom.

Second question, is there a way to change the default zoom percentages. Instead of 100-110-120-150 ect... to 100-120-150-175-200-225-250 and so on.

Thirdly does firefox automatically have tabs sleep when not in use to save ram. If not, where would I activate it?

Thank you for any answers, it's very appreciated.

title: Tabs keep crashing
content:
I've had Firefox since it's been around and not had this issue, I have a Mac with OS Monterey 12.6. Firefox is up to date and about two weeks ago with about 10 tabs open a tab crashed which probably hasn't happened in a couple years. I tried re-opening but it just crashed. I clicked the next and it crashed, then to the next and it crashed, etc. They all crashed soon as you clicked on them. I switched over to Chrome to see if I could even look something up because as soon as you clicked on anything with Firefox it crashed. I restarted Firefox and tabs just crashed. I let it sit and came back 8 hours later & all worked fine. A day later tabs started crashing again. On and off for the last two weeks tabs just keep crashing intermittently on Firefox and they only way to fix it is take a break and come back in an hour+. Then maybe a tab will crash and it will continue to work for a little while when you restart tab or maybe it will just crash as fast as you click Restart Tab. I currently have 2 crashed tabs and I'm surprised its letting my type this with a crashed tab, when I tried opening another, it just opened a crashed tab. I wouldn't doubt if it crashes in the middle of typing and I have to come back in an hour to finish. I can't find a solution on Google and if this keeps up, I'm going to have to drop Firefox as this happens throughout the day for work. Any Ideas what this might be? If you think it's a computer issue, I'll call Apple, but no solutions on Google make sense. Thanks for any help.

Note, these tabs are crashing on every site you can think of from Yahoo, Mail, Google, Facebook, Amazon, youtube, etc.

title: Firefox se ejecuta solo al iniciar windows.
content: Buenos días y feliz año. Cada vez que arranco el ordenador, al rato, se abre firefox con una pestaña de publicidad. Si inicio yo el navegador antes de que lo haga él solo, al rato también se me abre una pestaña de publicidad. He probado todas las soluciones posibles, como cambiar true por false en toolkit.winRegisterApplicationRestart, abrir carpeta de perfil y eliminar el archivo handlers.json, restablecer firefox... No es que sea muy molesto, ya que cuando se abre la pestaña, la cierrro y y no vuelve a aparecer a no ser que reinicie o apague y vuelva a encender, pero me gustaría saber cómo puedo evitar que ocurra. Muchas gracias.

title: ¿Piensa Mozilla hacer algo para solucionar los problemas de certificados digitales de los DNI electrónicos?
content:
La experiencia de uso del DNIe con Firefox es sencillamente lamentable.

Primero, para poder usarlo tienes que iniciar sesión en el módulo PKCS#11 con la contraseña de tu DNIe. Un paso totalmente inútil porque luego te la vuelve a pedir la aplicación de DNIe que es quien gestiona la autenticación realmente. Este paso estúpido no existe en Google Chrome.

Luego, en la pasarela de autenticación nacional te quedas esperando unos cuantos minutos hasta que sale el error de conexión fallida. Le das a recargar la página y sale el error SEC_ERROR_PKCS11_GENERAL_ERROR y ya es imposible hacer nada.

En otras pasarelas como las autonómicas a veces se queda totalmente colgado, otras veces se cierra por completo y otras veces consigues acceder (después de esperar un buen rato).

En Google Chrome introduzco la contraseña una sola vez y funciona en todas las pasarelas en cuestión de segundos.

Para colmo, no puedo contactar con Mozilla de ninguna manera para avisar de los errores y tengo que escribir aquí a ver si algun voluntario tiene algún primo que tenga un amigo que conozca a Richard Stallman para que pueda decirle a algún ingeniero (en el mal sentido) de Mozilla que hay toda una maldita colección de errores en una de las características más críticas de los navegadores, que es el uso del DNI electrónico para hacer cualquier cosa seria relacionada con las administraciones y servicios públicos. De manera que tengo que utilizar Firefox para los jueguecitos y las tonterías y para las cosas serias tengo que ir a Google Chrome.

Todos los navegadores son más o menos iguales con las mismas características, aspecto y rendimiento. De hecho son casi idénticos. No me extraña nada que Google Chrome haya terminado acaparando todo el mercado y derrotando de esta manera a Mozilla Firefox. Google tiene una característica que le falta a Mozilla y que no tiene nada que ver con la tecnología: seriedad.
creator: Tatiman

title: Google often does not load
content:

Once it's had it's moment, and successfully fails to load Google, I can try again and it will instantly load Google when I try again, and will continue to do so for a while.

Any idea on a solution or anything I can try to stop this issue occuring?
